oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Material dependence of negative bias temperature instability (NBTI) stress and recovery in SiON p-MOSFETs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAHAPATRA, S
MAHETA, VD
DEORA, S
KUMAR, EN
PURAWAT, S
OLSEN, C
AHMED, K
ISLAM, AE
ALAM, MA
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: i-dlin technique
interface-trap generation
field-effect transistors
degradation
issues
plasma
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Negative Bias Temperature Instability (NBTI) is studied in Silicon Oxynitride (SiON) p-MOSFETs using a recently developed Ultra-Fast On-The-Fly linear drain current (UF-OTF I(DLIN)) method. It is shown that both stress and recovery phases of NBTI are strongly influenced by SiON gate insulator process. Gate insulator nitrogen (N) spatial distribution is shown to impact interface trap generation (Delta N(IT)) and hole trapping (Delta N(h)) components of overall threshold voltage shift (Delta V(T)). A simple, self consistent method is proposed to isolate Delta N(IT) and Delta N(h). It is shown that the time dynamics of stress and recovery phases are strongly correlated, at short time governed by trapping and detrapping of holes, and at long time by generation and passivation of interface traps.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: SILICON NITRIDE, SILICON DIOXIDE, AND EMERGING DIELECTRICS 10,19(2)243-263
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Symposium on Silicon Nitride, Silicon Dioxide Thin Insulating Films and Emerging Dielectrics held at the 215th ECS Meeting,San Francisco, CA,MAY 24-29, 2009
